job_title: Bereavement Manager in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Kind people and leadership wants to support staff
cons: Haven’t found any yet, I’m very happy

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Dr. Towbin really cares about his colleagues. You will have fulfilling work and great support from your team.
cons: 1. The entire management group will use your compassion against you, pressuring you to take on too many tasks with too high of a caseload. You will want to work more than 15-hour days, because you care about your patients, but your manager will not care about you. 2. Senior leadership has a "this is how we have always done things" attitude and is resistant to any innovation and change. When presented with new ideas they will find any and all excuses on why not to try. 3. You will have all managers barking orders at you that need to be completed ASAP, many of them will be contradictory to each other. You will have no clear direction and will be written up for using your clinical judgment. 4. The president loves attention on himself and will take all the credit and pass all the blame to you.

job_title: Social Worker in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Front line staff are incredible & very caring.
cons: Management doesn’t value the employees. They make it clear you are replaceable. Management has its own agenda & doesn’t listen to the direct care staff. There is little concern about the quality of care being provided. It is all about the number of visits you make

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Collins, CO
cons: Toxic work environment and when you make a complaint, you are treated disrespectfully.

review_title: Not the organization it used to be
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Hospice Medical Director Dr. Towbin is the best in the business. Colleagues are doing their best to support and care for patients and each other with minimal resources.
cons: Toxic and punitive work environment. Pushed daily to do more with fewer/no resources. No effort whatsoever to retain the best, most dedicated employees or physicians/NPs which has resulted in revolving door and poor morale. Seasoned staff must train new hires who are then paid more than those with years of seniority. President leads by force, places emphasis on increasing census numbers without the resources to do it. Management resistant to change outdated processes, unresponsive in a crisis. Clinical director always “in a meeting.” Pathways used to have a team of dedicated providers who loved their work. That is no longer the case. President signed over all control of operations to Care Synergy which ran it into the ground. Despite claims to the contrary, Pathways does not operate independently of Care Synergy. Care Synergy sits on the board!. Expect your position and work hours/salary to look nothing like what you are hired to do. Those who stay are abused to the point that they can no longer tolerate the situation and quit. “Thanks for all you do” means nothing when management actions speak to the contrary. Mass exodus of employees, unstable environment, repeated furloughs because of the debt created by president. Most experienced and well trained staff are now gone. President blames every issue on the pandemic, even problems that existed prior. Takes no ownership of His bad decisions. Busies himself with worthless tasks such as changing mission statement and scheduling more “employee engagement sessions” to try to save face with no concerted effort to change. Expect to be unseen and unheard by your manager. In the event of a problem or misunderstanding, the staff is to blame…always. Expect annual evaluation from manager who holds down score to avoid having to pay people more for their hard work and dedication. Expect to hear a lot about “financial headwinds” while Care Synergy rakes in the cash. In the event of another pandemic, expect President to jump to head of the line for HIS vaccination prior to employees who are on the front lines of caregiving….expect him to have his picture taken while doing it. Nothing will change until there is a management overhaul from the top. Those who remain are looking elsewhere. Board members who come to staff meetings appear to have no knowledge of these issues which are negatively impacting patient care.

pros: The pay is good, family oriented and make you feel like family
cons: Travel too much and wanna work one location

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Collins, CO

pros: Every staff member I have encountered is mission driven and feels a purpose for working at Pathways. The weld county team is especially amazing!

review_title: Hospice in general is a lot

job_title: Variety of Positions Over Years in Fort Collins, CO
pros: The work itself is meaningful and rewarding.  When actually engaging in the caring service hospice provides employees report feeling that they are happy and satisfied.
cons: The management style is punitive and negative.  The leadership is secretive and fear-based.   The Board fo Directors is finance driven rather than mission driven.  When given feedback from employees about the punitive and toxic nature of supervision and management, the HR director finds it easier to blame employees than explore the common factors in the feedback.

review_title: Poor management and nice front line staff
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Collins, CO
pros: Caring and dedicated front line staff.
cons: High staff burnout and turnover, they don't want you coming into the office, only paid for mileage after 20 miles to and from your home, travel time may not be included, you may be relocated to another county without any choice.  Be careful what Pathways advertises and tells you in interviews to hire you. Get everything in writing including location and hours before you start.
